page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: A Bronze Age Cist was discovered in 1866 at the highest point in Law. The capstone of the cist was 2 feet below ground level and was 1 foot thick.The cist was one rough stone,9 inches thick,on each side and two stones at each end.It was 3 feet 4 inches long by 1foot 8 inches wide by 2 feet 3 inches deep.The bottom was natural rock. Underneath the capstone was a crouched skeleton and a bronze dagger. The dagger was about 5 inches long but the tip was damaged. Down the centre of the blade was a mid-rib,rounded in section.Two large rivets remained in position,and a third large rivet,found loose,had presumably rested in the notch in the top edge of the blade.The rivets were half an inch long with expanded heads.The cist can still be seen in a garden in Quarry Road.
